title: spack compiler find does not find FE compilers on Cray
body:
I'm seeing a problem on Cray where `spack compiler find` does not
identify the FE compiler modules, at least for GNU.

Cray has several modules for compilers and separate FE and BE arch
types.  For GNU at least, the raw modules are front-end compilers.
It's only the Cray wrappers (cc, CC, ftn) that add the back-end
specific options.  I'm not sure how Intel, PGI or Clang handle this.

For example, on theta at ANL, I switch to `PrgEnv-gnu` and load module
`gcc/7.3.0`.  The FE C compiler is `/opt/gcc/7.3.0/bin/gcc` and the BE
compiler is the `cc` wrapper.

But spack fails to see `/opt/gcc/7.3.0/bin/gcc` as a FE compiler.

For example, again on theta at ANL, I remove my `compilers.yaml` file
and run `spack compiler find` from scratch.  I get these compilers.

```
$ spack compiler list
==> Available compilers
-- cce cnl6-any -------------------------------------------------
cce@8.7.7  cce@8.7.3  cce@8.6.5  cce@8.6.3  cce@8.6.1  cce@8.5.8
cce@8.7.6  cce@8.7.0  cce@8.6.4  cce@8.6.2  cce@8.6.0  cce@8.5.7

-- gcc cnl6-any -------------------------------------------------
gcc@8.2.0  gcc@7.3.0  gcc@7.2.0  gcc@7.1.0  gcc@6.3.0  gcc@6.1.0  gcc@5.3.0  gcc@4.9.3

-- gcc sles12-x86_64 --------------------------------------------
gcc@4.8

-- intel cnl6-any -----------------------------------------------
intel@19.0.3.199  intel@18.0.5.274  intel@18.0.2.199  intel@17.0.2.174  intel@16.0.3.210
intel@19.0.2.187  intel@18.0.3.222  intel@18.0.0.128  intel@17.0.1.132
intel@19.0.1.144  intel@18.0.2.199  intel@17.0.4.196  intel@17.0.0.098
```

Note: the only FE (sles12-x86_64) GNU compiler it finds is gcc 4.8.5
from `/usr/bin/gcc`.  And further attempts to find the compiler don't
work.  I have to add the full compiler: entry in compilers.yaml
manually.

```
$ module list
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:
  2) gcc/7.3.0
 23) PrgEnv-gnu/6.0.4
 ...

$ type -a gcc
gcc is /opt/gcc/7.3.0/bin/gcc
gcc is /usr/bin/gcc
gcc is /usr/bin/X11/gcc

$ /opt/gcc/7.3.0/bin/gcc --version
gcc (GCC) 7.3.0 20180125 (Cray Inc.)
Copyright (C) 2017 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

$ ./spack compiler find /opt/gcc/7.3.0 
==> Found no new compilers
==> Compilers are defined in the following files:
    /home/krentel/.spack/cray/compilers.yaml
```

I see the same problem on cori at NERSC and theta at ANL, both Cray.

I'm quite sure this used to work.  I update my compilers.yaml so
infrequently that it's hard to say how far back it was when it worked.
Maybe 3 months, 6 months, maybe 12.  But I think something has changed
in how spack reads the FE compilers on Cray.

But since it used to work, at some point, I can go back and try old
revs and apply binary search.
